title: Ticket #844: DAGParentNodeNames needs better documentation
description: I just noticed that the DAGParentNodeNames classad attribute that DAGMan sticks into the classads of node jobs is not in the manual anywhere other than in the 6.7 version history. This should be documented somewhere in the DAGMan section of the manual, and there should be an example of using it in a submit file.
remarks:
2009-Dec-28 10:58:45 by wenger:
This should also include definitions of all of the other attributes that get stuck into a node job's classad -- I'm going to look these up and put them into the ticket, and then Karen will write up the actual prose for the manual.

2009-Dec-28 13:05:07 by wenger:
Okay, there are two attributes that DAGMan sticks into the classads of node jobs: DAGManJobId and DAGParentNodeNames.

DAGManJobId: Condor ID (cluster only) of the DAGMan job that's the parent of this node job. (Only one layer deep for nested DAGs.)

* Example: 7768

DAGParentNodeNames: comma-separated list of the nodes that are the parents of the current node.

* Example: "B,C"

* Use 'arguments = $$([DAGParentNodeNames])' in submit file -- we should show an example in the manual; doesn't work for scheduler universe.

* Passed through condor_submit command line -- it's omitted if the command line would be too long (> _POSIX_ARG_MAX).
check_ins: 2010-Jan-21 13:25   Check-in [25229]: gittrac #844: definitions and examples for attributes DAGParentNodeNames and DAGManJobId (By Karen Miller )
creator: wenger
